Articles.Content:
I have devoted all of my Space Program budget since the first jet engine came to life to research the way jet mechanics work and to figure out new jets.

Since 0.17 we have the Aeris 3A. I thought that was not good enough.

I present: SCRAGGY-JET INDUSTRIES.

Here you will find a lot of jets, including gliders, bombers, fighters, commercial jets, and even kamikazes. As Scraggy-Jet Industries is just starting out, there is one fleet present at this very moment in time with the Albatross fleet under development

This is the current fleet. It consists of:

This is a medium range scout plane.

Cruising Altitude: 12-15KM

Cruising speed: 500-700m/s

Maneuverability: Decent, requires precision with landing, as most Scraggy-Jets do

This craft features a number of additional control surfaces which allow it to pull out great stunts and glides.

Cruising Altitude: 12-15KM

Cruising Speed: Varies

Maneuverability: High, requires precision with landing, as most Scraggy-Jets do.

Glideability: High, at least 5 minutes with decent piloting

Notes: This aircraft is a 'beefed up' version of the Aeris Command, it has more control surfaces to allow a faster turn, but is more dangerous to fly because if high G's the control surfaces induce.

This craft features also a jettisonable engine so that mass can be reduced. Beware, if you do not have an engine, you don't have thrust, duh!

This is a generic medium range craft that'll get the job done.

Cruising Altitude: 12-15KM

Cruising speed: Varies

Maneuverability: Decent, quite tricky to land due to the narrow wheelbase.

Aeris 4B: http://pastebin.com/4YY0uwEZ

Aeris Glide: http://pastebin.com/X8K6sC9m

Aeris Command: http://pastebin.com/QZpmhzyx

To install: Go to your KSP directory>saves>your save>SPH>Create a new wordpad file>Paste chosen craft>Save as>Any file type>Aeris_4B.craft

Edited October 7, 2012 by Scraggz
Downloads

Looks pretty cool.

Thanks a bunch! Development on the next fleet has already started, but not going great. I might post screenshots of numerous crashes.
